lines.text: I'm thinking this faked death idea is on the money, now!
Huh? Don't tell me you've got another harebrained explanation up your sleeve.
That first thing made sense, but-
Like, the bullet hole, let's focus on that next.
It's unnaturally round and tidy, right? Not typical for a bullet hole.
Sure, but the bleedin' is real typical.
Yeah, yeah, I'll get to that.
But... you know, <c=#FF0000>Portable Hole</c> makes temporary, nondestructive holes in stuff.
The spell lists a maximum radius... but it doesn't say anything about a <c=#FF00FF>minimum radius!</c>
If he cast it on <c=#FF00FF>himself,</c> he could create the appearance of a bullet hole, without actually getting hurt!
...Huh. Well, you can explain away the breathin' and the hole, but...
I mean, look at 'im. He's bleedin' all over. How's that constitute ''without actually gettin' hurt''?
Man, that part's easy! The answer's right in front of us!
